summary: This is a January 29, 2020 letter from defense attorneys Foy & SepLowitz LLC to the US Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case US v. Tova Noel, et al. The letter requests extensive information and materials related to the video surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including details about system failures, maintenance, footage of Epstein and the defendants, and the investigation into the destruction of video evidence.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking extensive discovery on the MCC's video surveillance system, indicating concerns about its operation and the integrity of evidence around Epstein's death.
The letter references an FBI investigation into the "destruction of video surveillance evidence at the MCC," suggesting this was a subject of official inquiry.
Specific video system failures are noted on July 29, 2019, and August 8-10, 2019, the latter period covering the immediate time before Epstein's death.
The indictment alleges the defendants (Noel and Thomas) failed to perform inmate counts, were asleep on duty, and browsed the internet instead of monitoring Epstein.
The defense requests all video footage of Jeffrey Epstein, including from before and after his alleged July 23 suicide attempt, highlighting the centrality of video evidence to the case.
